intro: Callitris gunnii, commonly known as the white cypress-pine, is a coniferous evergreen tree native to Australia. It belongs to the Cupressaceae family and is characterized by its scale-like leaves and distinctive cone structures. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Its bark is fibrous and flaky, and it can reach heights of up to 30 meters. Callitris gunnii plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for native wildlife.
